citations.narrative:
On December 8, 2024, all 7 dogs escaped from the outdoor run. The dogs were being housed in the run while their indoor
enclosures were being cleaned. The run is enclosed by fence with gates that latch around a metal pole. The dogs pushed
on the gate until the latch slipped past the pole and opened the gate. Six dogs were immediately recaptured in front of the
building. One dog, "Munchkin", took 2.5 hours to recapture and was running on nearby train tracks. The facility installed a
backup latch that cannot be pushed open.
Failure to provide housing structures that are designed to securely contain the dogs can result in escape and possible
injury or inability to recapture.
Housing facilities for dogs must be designed and constructed so that they are structurally sound. They must be kept in
good repair and they must contain the animals securely.
Correct by: Corrected by the facility prior to inspection. Continue to ensure the facilities contain the animals securely from
11/13/25 forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the IACUC representatives.
